content:
Agenda:

  • Using inference instead of tuple caused an (ICE)[https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/77993]. Potential fix https://github.com/sexxi-goose/rust/pull/26/files. Issue was there was a TyKind::Error(DelaySpanBug)

  • Using inference instead of tuple improvements in places but also a 3% regression in wg-grammar
    https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/77873#issuecomment-714091371. From the comment it seems like they are fine with us doing nothing. But I'm curious about the why? I kind of suspect the added obligation.

  • One of the things that the warning when the incomplete feature gate is used is the tracking issue. I think it should point either to the project board, and/or get some descriptive summary.

  • Do we update closure_origin just yet to use a Place, or do we start using Place for capture related stuff at once, in the next set of PRs

Progress update:

  • We made progress on the logging, and on improving expr_id for pointing to discriminant instead of pattern

  • Capture Analysis is mostly cleaned up and commented.
Just running a couple mins behind, should be on the call in 2 mins
@nikomatsakis can you upload the meeting from yesterday?
@Aman Arora https://youtu.be/eQJi0OB1SKQ
